titleInfo.title: Ranaway--From the Premises of the Undersigned.

mods.abstract: RANAWAY--FROM THE PREMISES OF THE undersigned on the morning of the 10th inst., negro girl FANNY. Said negro girl is of dark brown color, 21 years of age, about 5 feet 5 1/2 inches in height, stout but well-formed, and disposed to be very dressy. The only peculi-arity recollected about her person is, that one of her upper front teeth projects and is 1-16 of an inch longer than the rest of the set, which are good. The runaway is supposed to be harbored in the neighborhood by some of her friends. A liberal reward will be paid for her arrest, and an additional one for information that will lead to the detection and conviction of any one harboring her. JNO. THORNHILL, No. 6 Euterpe street. je13 tf

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
